Instruction: In a saucepan, combine sugar and butter over medium heat, stirring until melted and smooth. Add milk and vanilla, cooking until heated through. In a bowl, whisk together eggs and egg yolks; gradually add the warm mixture. Stir in the flour until just combined. Pour the batter evenly into the ramekins.
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Arrange 6 (6 ounce) ramekins on a baking sheet.

Stir the mixture until the chocolate is melted and well incorporated. Pour into ramekins and bake in the preheated oven until the center is just firm, 15 to 20 minutes. Take them out of the oven and let cool for 45 minutes, then refrigerate until chilled, approximately 6 hours.
Reposition the oven rack to the highest level and set the oven to broil.

Sprinkle sugar evenly over the tops of each creme brulee, then gently remove any excess sugar. Place the ramekins on a baking sheet and position them under the broiler until the sugar bubbles and turns a light caramel brown. Serve right away.
